item.title: Command
item.dc:creator: @_BBLLAARRGGHH __--BBLLAARRGGHH--__
item.description:
@_BBLLAARRGGHH wrote:

I have public void startClass() { int classes = 0; switch (classes) { case 1: addItem (995,2000); //rich break; case 2: addItem (995,200); //poor break; } }
And I need to make a command to say if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("l") { go to startClass, and do case 1 for the int classes. }
so in structure something like if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("l") { classes = 1 }

Read full topic

item.title: Command
item.dc:creator: @_BBLLAARRGGHH __--BBLLAARRGGHH--__
item.description:
@_BBLLAARRGGHH wrote:

K, I have a switch with case 1 and case 2

Any idea how to make A command to do one of these, like [code] if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“l”) {
do some stuff to do case 1
}

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“o”) {
do some stuff to do case 2
}[/code]

Read full topic
